text:
Sonia wept. 

"Katerina Ivanovna, please come home," she begged.

"Leave off, Sonia!" Katerina shouted, breathless. 

"You don’t understand. I won’t return to that drunken German." 

She glanced at the crowd. 

"Let Petersburg see my children begging. Their father served honorably." 

She believed her own words. 

"Raskolnikov!" she cried, rushing to him. 

"Explain to her! We must show our plight!" 

"Even organ-grinders earn a living," she insisted. 

"Everyone will see we are different. We are bereaved." 

She turned to her children. 

"Lida, stand straight! Kolya, dance!" 

"Why are you whimpering?" 

"What am I to do with them?"

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Katerina Ivanovna insists on begging in the streets to expose their plight, despite Sonia's pleas to return home.
